file_content.text: Let's deliver that gizmo to your friend and blast off this rock.
Been a while since I was at the Balmorran Arms Factory. Not sure I love what the Empire's done with the place.
Looks like we saved our spy. Nice work.
Had some close calls, but made it back in one piece. Your friend is eager for a chat.
I've done some crazy things, but this beats them all.
That was... heroic. These men owe you their lives. So do I.
I want every Imperial on Balmorra to know how a Jedi and a resistance doctor saved your lives.
Tell your comrades about us.
I'd never falsify a report--no matter how distasteful.
Surrender to the Republic Army. Help us end this war.
[Force Persuade] Change sides.
We'll surrender to the Republic Army. We'll help you end this war.
Guess I'm not the only one charmed by your beauty....
Just when I thought this couldn't get crazier....
You've been given a second chance. What you do with it is your business.
Your thanks don't interest me.
Leaving here would be a lot easier if there was another transport. Actually, I did see a speeder bike outside. Only seats one. Hmm....
I'll find my own way out, Doc. The speeder bike is yours.
You take it.
I just don't want to be a burden on you. Better this way.
Thanks. You're a pal.
You're honestly thinking about leaving me here?
Wait, you're abandoning me?
You'll be fine. You've got one of those laser sword things.
I'll find my own way out. I'm not sitting in your lap.
Just go already!
That goes double for me.
Never minded walking through enemy territory, long as the ammo holds out.
T7 = no good with speeder-bikes
Your friend Warren's at these coordinates. I'll meet you there. Good luck!
Keep those man-eating bugs off me! I'm working here!
Have you accessed the Imperial network?
Already downloaded everything. We were leaving when that Imperial medical transport landed for refueling. Avers and his men opened fire.
Balmorran scum! Murderers! My men are dying. We'll never reach the medcenter now.
You just made my season, Imp. Bet you've got some choice gear on that transport....
Greedy vermin. These soldiers were defending Balmorra!
There's a doctor here. He could keep your men alive.
We can save your wounded.
You just love irony, don't you?
Aiding the enemy is tactically disadvantageous.
Jedi offer = correct // Saving wounded enemies = Republic law
The only thing Balmorra needs defending from is you.
Those soldiers are invaders.
Still, they're dying. We can't just stand by and watch.
I can execute them cleanly. Just give the order.
Enemy wounded = dying // Republic war conduct = render aid
If you want a quick death, shut your mouth. Otherwise, I'll take my time.
You and your men are dead.
I don't care how obnoxious he is, killing wounded soldiers isn't right.
I can assemble a firing squad. Just say the word, Master Jedi.
Jedi = execute wounded? // War crimes = violates Jedi Code
Do you read? Colicoid nest stirred up by fighting. Waves of them headed for Sobrik's outskirts. Leave now or you'll be surrounded....
Colicoids? They'll rip us apart. Every man for himself! Move!
We can't flee. Those beasts will kill us!
I don't abandon wounded men, even Imperials. Then again, being eaten wasn't on my agenda for today.
I can save these soldiers, if someone keeps the Colicoids off me.
You work your medical magic. I'll take on the Colicoids. May the Force be with us.
Let's save the Imperials.
If we die, at least it'll be heroic. But we're not gonna die, right?
Do you hear that? They're here!
We can't save everyone. The Imperials will have to fend for themselves.
These men are on their own.
Take these medkits. They might help.
Spare us your charity. We'll die with honor.
It's too late. Get out of here. I'll be right behind you.
Leave, Doc. [Kill soldiers.]
Here, take these medkits. Maybe the Colicoids won't find you....
I hope they tear you limb from limb!
I'm meeting Warren at these coordinates. I'll see you there.
Idiot! Does he really think these medkits will help us?
You won't need them.
What are you.... No. No!
The resistance will move in once you clear off some of those Imperial forces at Sobrik. Good luck with those comm towers.
This super-advanced gadget you're after... the resistance can narrow down its location, but we need access to the enemy's computer network.
The only connection point is at Sobrik, which is covered in Imperial forces. Troop legions, walkers, heavy bombers. Fun place.
I'll find a way in there if I have to take on the whole Imperial Army.
I've faced worse.
Sounds pretty important. Why all the protection?
Tell me about Sobrik.
It's the manufacturing capital of the planet. All the best guns get made there.
That sounds like a perfect place to crush the Imperials.
Mobilize the army.
A frontal assault? Suicide. Place is covered in ray shields.
I believe we can diminish the Imperial forces without firing a shot.
The Empire has several comm relays around Sobrik, tied to other Imperial strongholds. An early warning system.
Great. When we attack, they can summon more troops to kill us.
Or, we make the Imperials think we're attacking their other strongholds.
We'll infiltrate those comm relays, upload fake alerts and siphon away Sobrik's defenders--leaving it vulnerable.
I doubt the Empire leaves its comm relays unguarded.
It can't be that easy.
If the Empire thinks it's under attack, won't they tighten Sobrik's defenses?
You're sure this will work?
Sobrik's commanders are noted for aggressive tactics--and they'll have every reason to believe they're secure.
We haven't got all day. If you have a plan, put it in motion.
Then get to work.
There are... complications to this idea.
The comm relays are protected by advanced Imperial war droids. Very fast, extremely deadly.
I'm no longer quick enough to defeat those war droids, but you are.
Then, the resistance can raid the Empire's computer network. We'll figure out where they've stashed that whatchamathingit you want.
Use this datapad on the comm relays to upload the fake emergency signals.
I'll find a good vantage spot to watch Sobrik and keep you informed of our progress. Be careful out there.
I got as many trauma kits as I could find.
Beautiful. The kits look good, too.
He's a walking hormone.
I can break him. Just say the word.
T7 = recommend electroshock treatment for Doc // T7 = willing to administer
The Imperials won't miss them. Our boys shoot to kill.
Apologies for being late. My detour around those Imperial forces took longer than expected.
I was worried. Glad you're here.
I'm relieved you're safe.
Forgive my bluntness, but you appear to be a Jedi who's seen many battles.
Where did you get those scars?
Mementos from my previous disagreements with Sith.
I was quite the warrior, once. Thought evil was something I could conquer with my lightsaber.
A lightsaber is merely a device. It's the will of the wielder that matters.
Weapons alone can't win.
The greatest will never require a weapon to express itself.
If that isn't the answer, what is?
You think differently now?
Taking an enemy's life only proves to his companions that you desire their deaths.
I've conquered quite a bit of evil with my lightsaber.
It is. I've proven that.
I remember that feeling of accomplishment when an enemy fell, but don't be deceived.
Peace cannot take root in fear, nor be nourished with blood. Master Braga taught me that.
You'd have been here on time if you'd blasted through those Imperials.
Detours are for cowards.
Better to leave the enemy ignorant than confirm its fears. Our success depends on maintaining secrecy.
You've done well, saving this facility and its patients. The resistance has already agreed to help us find the cloaking device prototype.
We'll get to know each other better when I have those trauma kits. Promise.
Did I mention people are dying? Get me those trauma kits--stat!
Hey, look at that. We're alive. Nice work.
Lot of wounded here. You're the only doctor?
Honey, I do the work of ten medics--and that's on a bad day.
Sensors detect multiple life-forms in distress // Trauma rate = severe
Is stating the obvious part of your programming?
Say, you might be wounded and not know it. Let me check you over.
The Force protects me. These others were not so fortunate.
I'm fine.
I feel fine--but you're the doctor....
Go ahead.
Let's see... uh-huh... hmm. You'll certainly need a more thorough exam... later.
Hands off. Does anyone fall for that line?
Don't touch me.
Just the lucky ones.
I don't know what genius picked a Colicoid breeding ground for our medical facility, but we need to evacuate quick.
Problem is, my critical patients are too fragile to move--and the Empire stole my trauma kits.
I won't let the Empire endanger your people's lives. How can I get what you need?
Then I'll get them back.
Staying here isn't an option. We're going to meet the resistance leaders--right now.
Move anyway.
Sweetheart, I don't care how gorgeous you are; I won't risk these people's lives. They trusted me to save them.
These people trusted me to save their lives. I'm not going anywhere until they're all safe.
You're racking up favors in a hurry, Doc. I need to see the resistance leaders. Make it happen.
Let's discuss your debt.
All right--but they won't be happy if my patients die while we stand here negotiating.
I'm here to steal something from the Empire. Your people need to help me.
Cooperate and I'll help you.
I can arrange that--if my patients survive.
Our scouts say the Imperials sent my trauma kits to their front-line troops on the plains nearby.
The depots will be guarded, but I'm sure you'll figure something out. Just hurry--these people don't have much time.
Heavy casualties. Estimate survival rate less than thirty-five percent.
Hundred percent, big guy. I haven't lost a patient yet.
Did I mention we're about to get eaten? Stop those blasted things!
The Jedi bought us time. Get our wounded to the secure area. Move it!
I'm the chief medic. Just call me Doc.
I appreciate your hard work, gorgeous--but there's a whole nest of Colicoids coming. No time to evacuate.
I'd never let anything bad happen to a nice guy like you.
[Flirt] Relax, handsome.
Not even if I asked nicely?
Call me "gorgeous" again, and you're Colicoid dinner.
Respect me, or else.
No offense intended, beautiful.
You and your gorgeous friend cleared a nice path, but we can't leave. Got a whole nest of Colicoids massing to attack.
My gorgeous friend is already spoken for, pal.
Don't flirt with Kira.
He doesn't need to know that.
No offense intended. You seem like a happy couple.
My friend is a Jedi Knight, like me. Respect that.
Don't flirt with Kira.
She's the most gorgeous Jedi Knight I've ever met. Better?
Not really.
Nice path you cleared outside. Too bad we can't evacuate. A whole nest of Colicoids will be here any second.
Take cover. This is about to get ugly.
Then get behind me.
Nothing's ugly while you're around, sweetheart.
It's been ugly for a while. Just keeps getting uglier.
What are these Colicoids?
Colicoids?
Things that eat you.
When I'm done saving your facility, we'll discuss your debt.
You people owe me.
Resistance fighting pays lousy. Keep your expectations low.
I've got dozens of wounded here. Hope you're not one of those junior Jedi.
Do we have to save him, too?
Guerilla fighters. No respect for authority.
Jedi = almost Master // You = idiot
I'll head for the secure area and stabilize casualties... here they come!
Can't talk right now, gorgeous--but definitely later.
Sorry, I can only carry on one fascinating conversation at a time.
Colicoids are burrowing into the med lab! I could use a little help here!
The Colicoids will eat us alive if the tunnels stay open. You can collapse them with your Jedi tricks, right?
The Colicoids just dug their own private door in here. They're burrowing up behind you!
Here, take these weapons and supplies--and good luck.
